alert.note: Alert for McDowell (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 8:45AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall yesterday and last night. * WHERE...A portion of southern West Virginia, including the following county, McDowell. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 838 AM EST, the river stage at Bradshaw was 10.84 feet. Flood stage was 10 feet. The river has crested and will fall below flood stage by early Sunday afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bradshaw and Jolo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
